Check of Levi Davis to Abraham Lincoln, 1 March 18391 $30200/100No.1452 Cashier of theVandalia BranchState Bank of Illinois, Pay toAbraham Lincolnor order, the sum ofThree hundred & Twodollars and—cents, it being infullfor his services as a member of theGeneral Assembly, Session1838 & 9 (The holder of this warrant will be entitled to six per cent. interest from date,

paragraphs: Check of Levi Davis to Abraham Lincoln, 1 March 18391

Cashier of theVandalia BranchState Bank of Illinois, Pay toAbraham Lincolnor order, the sum ofThree hundred & Twodollars and—cents, it being infullfor his services as a member of theGeneral Assembly, Session1838 & 9

(The holder of this warrant will be entitled to six per cent. interest from date,
                  until redeemed by the State.2
citations: An Act Making Appropriations for the Years 1837 and 1838;An Act Making Partial Appropriations.

footnotes.text:
1This partially printed check was filled in by Levi Davis and signed by Davis and John
                  D. Whiteside. Abraham Lincoln endorsed it on the back side.

2Members of the General Assembly earned $4 for each day’s attendance at the session,
                  plus an additional $4 for every twenty miles of necessary travel in coming to and
                  returning from the statehouse. In addition, members periodically received additional
                  sums--often $100--through partial appropriation bills.An Act Making Appropriations for the Years 1837 and 1838;An Act Making Partial Appropriations.
